concise_definition: n. 烧焦的痕迹, 烧毁的部分; v. 烧焦, 烧毁

definitions.explanation_en: A blackened or burned fragment or mark left on something after exposure to fire or extreme heat; often refers to the remnants of something partially consumed by flames.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指物体在暴露于火焰或高温后留下的黑色烧焦碎片或痕迹，通常指被部分烧毁后的残留物。
definitions.example_en: The fire left only chars of the wooden furniture.
definitions.example_cn: 这场大火只留下了木制家具的焦炭残骸。

definitions.explanation_en: To burn something slightly or partially, especially on the surface, turning it black or brown through exposure to heat.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指使某物表面轻微或部分烧焦，通过受热使其变黑或变褐。
definitions.example_en: She charred the edges of the toast by leaving it in the toaster too long.
definitions.example_cn: 她把吐司在烤面包机里放太久，导致边缘烧焦了。

definitions.explanation_en: To cause something to become blackened or carbonized through burning, often unintentionally or as a result of overheating.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指因燃烧或过热而导致某物变黑或碳化，常为非故意行为。
definitions.example_en: The engine overheated and charred the metal casing.
definitions.example_cn: 发动机过热，导致金属外壳被烧焦。

comparison.analysis: “Burn” (燃烧) 是更通用的词，指任何程度的燃烧过程，包括完全焚毁或产生火焰；而 “char” 特指表面或局部的烧焦，通常保留物体的基本形状，不涉及完全燃烧。
“Scorch” (灼烧) 指因高温导致表面变色或轻微损伤，但通常不产生明显的黑色碳化物；而 “char” 强调形成黑色焦炭状残留物，程度更深、更明显。
“Carbonize” (碳化) 是一个更技术性的术语，指在缺氧条件下加热有机物使其转化为碳，常用于工业或化学语境；而 “char” 是日常用语，描述可见的烧焦现象，不强调化学过程。
